channel.title: Hazardous Waste Test Methods / SW-846
channel.description: Updated Hazardous Waste Test Methods / SW-846 content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: EPA's Streamlined Procedure for Publishing Non-Regulatory SW-846 Methods
item.description:
On this page: 

  • Summary of the New Process
  • Steps for Publication of Methods
  • Sign up for the SW-846 Mailing List

Summary of the New Process

EPA announced a streamlined approval process for non-regulatory SW-846 methods in the Federal Register on September 27, 2016. Beginning in late October, 2016, non-regulatory methods will be announced for public comment and for final posting on the EPA Hazardous Waste Test Methods web page, rather than through the Federal Register. This new procedure allows for expedited method release, while still incorporating comments from the scientific community. The process for updating SW-846 analytical methods that are required in the RCRA regulations (method defined parameters) will not change, and will still use the Federal Register. 

  • View the Announcement in the Federal Register.

Top of Page

Steps for Publication of Methods

Once SW-846 methods have undergone a final review from the SW-846 method workgroup, EPA will:

  1. Obtain Agency organic and/or inorganic workgroup approval of new and/or revised methods. These Agency workgroups consist of EPA scientists from the Regions and program offices.
  2. Post methods on the “Validated Methods” web page  and link to the Hazardous Waste Test Methods landing page.
  3. Notify the SW-846 analytical community via emails and web posting of the comment-period initiation date. The comment period will be set for a minimum of 30 days, depending on the number and complexity of methods.
  4. Catalog and respond to public comments in a “Response to Comments” document.
  5. Revise methods based on EPA’s review of comments.
  6. Post the new and/or revised methods, the “Response to Comments” background document(s), and other supporting documents permanently on the “SW-846 Compendium” web page.
  7. Email the SW-846 mailing list, notifying all entities of the incorporation of the new additions to the SW-846 compendium.

Top of Page

Sign Up for the SW-846 Mailing List

To sign up for email notifications about methods being released for public comment or added to the SW-846 compendium, check the "sign up for email notifications" button on the Contact Us page.

Top of Page
item.dc:creator: gharman

item.title: SW-846 Test Method 8290A: Polychlorinated Dibenzodioxins (PCDDs) and Polychlorinated Dibenzofurans (PCDFs) by High-Resolution Gas Chromatography/High Resolution Mass Spectrometry (HRGC/HRMS)
item.description:
This method provides procedures for the detection and quantitative measurement of polychlorinated dibenzo-p-dioxins (tetra- through octachlorinated homologues; PCDDs), and polychlorinated dibenzofurans (tetra- through octachlorinated homologues; PCDFs) in a variety of environmental matrices and at part-per-trillion (ppt) to part-per-quadrillion (ppq) concentrations. 

  • Method 8290A: Polychlorinated Dibenzodioxins (PCDDs) and Polychlorinated Dibenzofurans (PCDFs) by High-Resolution Gas Chromatography/High Resolution Mass Spectrometry (HRGC/HRMS), Part of Test Methods for Evaluating Solid Waste (PDF)(72 pp, 257 K, February 2007)
item.dc:creator: gharman

item.title: Referred Air Method OTM 14: Method for Measuring Isocyanates in Stationary Source Emissions
item.description:
Formerly known as Air Method 0207, this method is applicable to the collection and analysis of isocyanate compounds from the emissions associated with manufacturing processes.

This method was developed by EPA's Emissions Measurement Center.

  • Referred Air Method OTM 14: Method for Measuring Isocyanates in Stationary Source Emissions, part of Test Methods for Evaluating Solid Waste, Physical/Chemical Methods (PDF)(42 pp, 870 K)
item.dc:creator: clangloi

item.title: Referred Air Method 25E: Determination of a Vapor Phase Organic Concentration in Waste Samples
item.description:
This method is applicable for determining the vapor pressure of waste. The headspace vapor of the sample is analyzed for carbon content by a headspace analyzer, which uses a flame ionization detector (FID).

This method was developed and promulgated by EPA's Emissions Measurement Center.

  • Referred Air Method 25E: Determination of Vapor Phase Organic Concentration in Waste Samples, part of Test Methods for Evaluating Solid Waste, Physical/Chemical Methods (PDF)(6 pp, 134 K)
item.dc:creator: clangloi

item.title: Referred Air Method 25D: Determination of the Volatile Organic Concentration of Waste Samples
item.description:
This method is applicable for determining the volatile organic (VO) concentration of a waste sample.

This method was developed and promulgated by EPA's Emissions Measurement Center.

  • Referred Air Method 25D: Determination of the Volatile Organic Concentration of Waste Samples, part of Test Methods for Evaluating Solid Waste, Physical/Chemical Methods (PDF)(18 pp, 247 K)
item.dc:creator: clangloi

item.title: Policy Statement about the Test Methods for Evaluating Solid Waste: Physical/Chemical Methods Compendium (SW-846)
item.description:
The policy statement, a part of the Federal Register Notice of Availability for Update V, details Environmental Protection Agency’s (EPA) commitment to define language regarding method status and the recommended version of the method to use. Additionally, the policy statement provides information regarding EPA’s method numbering system and the process used for method publication. The Statement also discusses the Methods Innovation Rule (MIR), the Flexible Approach to Environmental Measurement, as well as SW-846 methods status definitions.

  • Policy Statement (PDF)(5 pp, 151 K)
item.dc:creator: clangloi

item.title: Acknowledgements for the Test Methods for Evaluating Solid Waste: Physical/Chemical Methods Compendium (SW-846)
item.description:
The acknowledgements thank groups and organizations who originally assisted in the preparation of the SW-846 manual.  

  • Acknowledgements (PDF)(1 pg, 60 K)
item.dc:creator: clangloi

item.title: Preface for the Test Methods for Evaluating Solid Waste: Physical/Chemical Methods Compendium (SW-846)
item.description:
The preface describes the purpose of the manual, the organization and format, and how the method numbers are designated.  

  • Preface (PDF)(2 pp, 109 K)
item.dc:creator: clangloi

item.title: Status Table for the Test Methods for Evaluating Solid Waste: Physical/Chemical Methods Compendium (SW-846)
item.description:
The status table is a reference guide that identifies the historical and latest versions of SW-846 methods, chapter text and other documents.  

  • Methods Status Table (PDF)(16 pp, 311 K)
